intro: Phyllanthus mouensis, commonly known as the Moungou plant, is a species of flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, green, fleshy leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in swampy or wetland areas. It has a compact growth habit and is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Its botanical features make it an important species in the ecological systems of its native habitat.
